title: 16-Year-Old Fatally Shot
content:
Error loading player: No playable sources found
Franklin, La.
A St Mary Parish family is mourning after a 16-year-old is gunned down in Franklin.
Shots were fired just before 4:00 Sunday afternoon on Augustine Maze Street. Neighbors reported multiple shots were fired.
Braylen Foulcard, a junior at West St Mary High School was pronounced dead on scene.
Monday morning, a 15-year-old was arrested and charged with first degree murder. The juvenile was booked, processed and is being held at a juvenile housing facility until court proceedings.
"I'm in shock because these two kids were some good kids and I never expected that they'd turn to this side of life," said David, a neighbor.
He says the teens were friends and always laughing.
"They always showed a good side of themselves, both of them did," said David. "It wasn't like they was no troubled kids or anything. They both come from pretty decent families."
Police are staying tight lipped about the case because juveniles are involved, but neighbors say the teens were in a car and crashed into a fence during the shooting.
"It's gonna tear those two families apart, but I wish that they can mend things, get over this and pull together," said David.
Grief counselors will be at West St Mary High School as long as they're needed to help students and staff cope with the loss of their classmate.
